Package game

Class GameWorld

java.lang.Object
mayflower.World
game.GameWorld
public class GameWorld extends mayflower.World
The drawing for the game

      The dimensions (in pixels) of the blocks (tiles without the borders)

    • BLOCK_BORDER_WIDTH

      public static int BLOCK_BORDER_WIDTH
      How large (in pixels) the border of a given tile is. This is the distance between where a block ends and where the same tiles ends.

    • BLOCK_BORDER_HEIGHT

      public static int BLOCK_BORDER_HEIGHT
      How large (in pixels) the border of a given tile is. This is the distance between where a block ends and where the same tiles ends.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameWorld

      public GameWorld(GameClient client, Game game)
      Constructs a GameWorld instance with the specified client and game.
      Parameters:
      client - The client associated with the game world.
      game - The game logic associated with the game world.

  • Method Details

    • renderGrid

      public void renderGrid()
      Renders the grid. Inclues only blocks in the grid, plus the score text. Should be called whenever game state is changed.

    • convertToPixels

      public static Coordinate convertToPixels(Coordinate c)
      Converts a coordinate in the grid to a pixel coordinate on the screen.
      Parameters:
      c - the Coordinate representation of the position in the grid to convert.
      Returns:
      an array of pixel coordinates. The first element is the X coordinate, and the second element is the Y coordinate.

    • calculateBlockPixel

      public static Coordinate calculateBlockPixel(Coordinate c)
      Calculates what pixel a given block should be placed at given a Coordinate on the grid.
      Parameters:
      c - The Coordinate (in tiles) of the wanted conversation
      Returns:
      The converted Coordinate in terms of pixels

    • removeMovingBlock

      public void removeMovingBlock(MovableGridItem b)
      A method that processes whenever a block finishes its animation. Once all blocks are done with their animation, the grid is rendered and queued blocks are spawned.
      Parameters:
      b - The MovableGridItem that has finished its animation

    • act

      public void act()
      Called every gameframe.
      Specified by:
      act in class mayflower.World

    • spawnRandomBlocks

      public void spawnRandomBlocks(int numBlocks)
      Spawn a certain amount of blocks into the grid. Blocks will be randomly placed into empty tiles. If there are no more empty tiles, nothing will happen. Sends the blocks created over the client to be placed.
      Parameters:
      numBlocks - number of blocks to spawn in

    • getTurnGraphic

      public TurnGraphic getTurnGraphic()
      Gets the object representation of the TurnGraphic
      Returns:
      The object representation of the TurnGraphic

    • addQueuedBlock

      public void addQueuedBlock(int row, int col, int value)
      Adds a block to spawn into the queue.
      Parameters:
      row - the row of the block to spawn in
      col - the column of the block to spawn in
      value - the value of the block to spawn in
